required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: US Phase III Study of APD421 in PONV
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Phase III Study of APD421 (Amisulpride for IV Injection) as Prophylaxis Against Post-operative Nausea and Vomiting

brief_summary.textblock: A comparison of the efficacy of APD421 and placebo in the prevention of PONV in patients at moderate-to-high risk of PONV.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Complete Response
primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after the end of surgery
primary_outcome.description: The primary efficacy analysis was a comparison of the incidence of Complete Response, defined as no emesis (vomiting or retching) and no use of rescue medication in the 24 hours after the end of surgery, between the active group and the placebo group using Pearson χ2 test with Yates's continuity correction, and with a two-sided significance level of 5%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With no Nausea.
secondary_outcome.description: Nausea (defined as the desire to vomit without the presence of expulsive muscular movements) measured on a 0-10 verbal response scale, where 0=no nausea at all and 10=the worst nausea imaginable. "No nausea" means no score ≥ 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With no Emesis
secondary_outcome.description: Emesis is defined as vomiting (production of even the smallest amount of stomach contents) or retching (muscular movements of vomiting but without expulsion of stomach contents, usually because of an empty stomach)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With no Use of Rescue Medication
secondary_outcome.description: Any agent given in the post-operative period with the intention of providing anti-emetic rescue was counted as rescue anti-emetic medication for the purposes of efficacy determination, even if it did not achieve control of emesis or was given incorrectly (e.g., wrong dosage or route). Any agent given in the post-operative period which would be expected, by virtue of its pharmacology, dosage and route, to exert a clinically meaningful anti-emetic effect was considered as rescue anti-emetic medication, even if administered inadvertently or without the intention of providing rescue.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants With no Emesis, no Significant Nausea and no Use of Rescue Medication
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after the end of surgery
secondary_outcome.description: No occurrence of vomiting/retching, no nausea score ≥ 4 on verbal response scale (where 0=no nausea at all and 10=the worst nausea imaginable) and no use of rescue medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants With no Significant Nausea
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after the end of surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Nausea (defined as the desire to vomit without the presence of expulsive muscular movements) measured on a 0-10 verbal response scale, where 0=no nausea at all and 10=the worst nausea imaginable. "No significant nausea" means no score ≥ 4.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after the end of surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Total response is defined as no occurrence of vomiting/retching, no nausea score ≥ 1 and no use of rescue medication.

arm_group.description: APD421 (amisulpride), at 5mg given by single intravenous (IV) administration by slow push over one minute at induction of anaesthesia.
Matching placebo given by single IV administration by slow push over one minute at induction of anaesthesia

intervention.description: APD421 ( Amisulpride) at 5mg given by single intravenous (IV) administration, by slow push over one minute, at induction of anaesthesia
Matching Placebo given by single intravenous (IV) administration, by slow push over one minute, at induction of anaesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female patients ≥ 18 years of age
- Patients undergoing elective surgery (open or laparoscopic technique) under general anaesthesia, expected to last at least one hour from induction of anaesthesia to wound closure and expected to require at least one overnight stay in hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients scheduled for outpatient/day case surgery
- Patients scheduled to undergo intra-thoracic, transplant or central nervous system surgery
- Patients scheduled to receive only a local anaesthetic/regional neuraxial (intrathecal or epidural) block
- Patients who are expected to remain ventilated for a period after surgery
- Patients who are expected to need a naso- or orogastric tube in situ after surgery is completed

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 364 patients enrolled in the study (i.e. signed informed consent form), 22 patients were not randomised and not dosed. Of these, 4 withdrew their consent, 3 did not comply with the protocol procedures and 15 were not dosed for other unspecified reasons.

group.title: 5mg APD421
group.description: A 5mg (2mL) dose of APD421 given by slow intravenous (IV) push over one minute at induction of anaesthesia

group.title: Placebo
group.description: 2mL of placebo given by slow intravenous (IV) push over one minute at induction of anaesthesia

baseline.population: A total of 342 patients were randomised and dosed, comprising 176 randomised to APD421 and 166 to placebo. Of these, 4 patients from the APD421 group and 2 patients from the placebo group discontinued prematurely after randomisation

group.title: 5mg Dose APD421
group.description: A 5mg dose of APD421 given by slow push, single intravenous (IV) administration over a time frame of one minute at induction of anaesthesia

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Single dose placebo given through intravenous (IV) administration

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: There were no limitations and caveats in this study.
